snippet: New Jersey Institute of Technology, which knocked Michigan out of the Top 25 in Ann Arbor on Saturday, is the only independent team in Division I.
abstract: New Jersey Institute of Technology, which ousted No 17 Michigan out of the Top 25, is the only independent team in Division I basketball; school is having increasingly difficult time finding opponents, and NCAA has offered no help, actually making task even more difficult by placing moratorium on Division II teams moving up to Division 1 as independents.
lead_paragraph: New Jersey Institute of Technology, which knocked Michigan out of the Top 25 in Ann Arbor on Saturday, is the only independent team in Division I.

headline.main: Giant-Killer N.J.I.T. Stands Alone, Without a Conference
headline.print_headline: Giant-Killer N.J.I.T. Stands Alone, Without a Conference
